page.title: 12RELIGION
page.content: In Sidlesham there are two religous meeting places.There is the parish church of Saint Mary,the vicar is Canon Hawkins. Saint Marys is about 700 years old some of it was restored in 1746. About two years ago the methodist chapel closed because it was not safe. Roman Catholics and free church christians have to worship in Selsey or Chichester. Other groups such as muslims would have to go further afield. Sometimes lay readers and priests from other churches assist with services. About forty-five people attend the Sunday services. In a whole year there is an average of six weddings, eight baptisms and twelve funerals. There are also special services like Harvest Festival, Remembrance Day and the Guides Thinking Day.
